answers.answer: I would take an appnt. To a chiropractor who takes pregnant woman! Since I vé ben pregnant I went 3 times and rarely have any headaches or backaches! :) and if that is not enough then I would go to my doc. Good luck!

I called the doc this MOrning and told them about how I've bewn feeling. still haven't  heard  anything bback nd the nurse is suppose to contact me. With something.  I've pueked twice today. Not fun At  all

I know your not supposed to take Excedrin for Migraines which I took before I got pregnant but twice during this pregnancy I took half a pill and it helped me. There's not much else that helps. There may be something your doctor can prescribe that's safe but Idk what else helps. Hope you feel better.

I downloaded an app called migraine buddy. what the app does is you can record when your having it (a migraine) how long it lasts, what you have ate, your sleeping schedule. Basically to see what is triggering them. And you can see what triggers them and it will help a lot. I was really dehydrated and that caused a lot of my pain. Hope this helped

I was getting bad headaches and after going to my dentist a few weeks ago I found out I was clenchingmy teeth.I think going to a chiropractor could also be helpful.I hope you feel better soon.Congratulations:)
Have you tried Tylenol with caffeine or Tylenol with a benadryl? That's what my midwife is having me do for migraines.

I've tried  a good bit of things. Before i got  prego  i had migraines before. I sis nerve  blockers about 7 years ago and that helped. My doc gave me fioricet to take. I know that works because ive taken it before.  They haven't been so bad the passed few days  just a Headache  here and there  but  not all day and night  right now

I started getting neck pain then loss of vision and headaches and it lasted 7 days the first time so I went to L&D to be cleared on preeclampsia then I was supposed to check into ER but I was in too much pain to wait any longer so I just called my OB the next day and he prescribed me migraine medication...it makes me feel funny but it's better than the migraines because they are an all day ordeal and last several days if I don't take the med...I've had 2 episodes this month so far. Hope you get some relief.
I've had this problem and my midwife prescribed fiorcet. I had a migraine for 9 days and couldn't take it any longer. Tylenol did nothing. I hope you feel better real soon.

question: Hey guys!  I'm 15.5 weeks and since saturday I've  had a recurring  migraine headache.  I havea bulging disk on the right side of my neck and i think a nerve is pinched as.to why i am in so much pain. The pain has been constant nonstop. Hurts to think. Tylenol isn't  helping or anything  to relax.It's  getting me  sick to my stomach. i get jolts or shocked from my head down my spinenand inhurts like hell!!! I just don't  want to go to the dr. Cause my daughter  can't  go with me since  they don't  allow kods.to go. Just curious what would.you do? Go in to the do, er or suck it up? Ive tried dealing with it and ican barely do anything without being in pain
title: migraines
